Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2008 09:25AM sausgirl wrote: Hi, As the others have said the most painful part is the initial lidocaine.Then my doc did a tiny incision and three biopsies and placed in the clip-that shows where the removed the suspected tumor.A bandaid and I don't even see it.Scarier than it is,it is a must. Good luck and take care, JanÂ
Posts.Title: Core Biopsy w/ U/S, what to expect? CorasMama Jo_Ann_K

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2008 10:34PM - edited Sep 24, 2008 12:21PM by sausgirl Hello all,I graduated from an AS program in California in 1987.Went straight into NICU,the followed up in PICU the next year.Over the years I did homecare,hospice,insurance and medical billing.A stroke in 1999 stopped my career.I agree that people believe that since you are in the profession you know what is going on-not! And that it is a little easier for you to assimilate the information-not!But it does get better. I don't feel we need a seperate area or whatever.We all have the same disease,we just come from a different perspective. Regards, Jan
Posts.Title: Nurses with Breast Cancer Jo_Ann_K PatRN10
